references.paper_title: The Cityscapes Dataset for Semantic Urban Scene Understanding
references.reason: It is a foundational dataset for autonomous driving research, providing a benchmark for evaluating object detection models in urban environments.

references.paper_title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
references.reason: CLIP's image-text embeddings are used extensively throughout the paper, providing a crucial foundation for open-vocabulary object detection.

references.paper_title: LVIS: A Dataset for Large Vocabulary Instance Segmentation
references.reason: LVIS is one of the primary datasets used for training the object detection model in the paper, providing a large-scale, richly annotated dataset for challenging object detection tasks.

references.paper_title: ImageNet: A large-scale hierarchical image database
references.reason: ImageNet-21k, a large-scale dataset with image-level labels, is crucial for providing weak supervision to the model and enhancing its generalizability.
This paper is foundational to the weakly supervised object detection (WSOD) approach used, highlighting the challenges and approaches involved in training detectors with limited annotations.
